1.content:
"Well, hello there. Fine night we're having, isn't it? Don't you just love October? The chill in the air, the plethora of color-changing leaves that flutter to the ground, the spooky decorations your friends and neighbors put up for all to see...I don't know about you, but it's my favorite time of the year.

Why don't you come join me here by the fire. It's warm and quite pleasant. Pull up a log, why don't ya? Grab a doughnut and pour yourselves a glass of warm apple cider. That's it, sit right on down. I don't bite..except for that one time, but...never mind that.

It's cozy, isn't it? Yeah, I though so.

Oh, where are my manners? I'm gettin' senile in my old age. My name's Ben Mears, and I'll be your host for this evening. What are you in the mood for tonight? Go ahead, speak up. What kind of creepy, crawly creatures do you wanna hear about? What's that you say? Ah, I love that one too. Everyone settled? Good.

Let's begin..."
1.title: Your Host

12.title: Lucy Palmwell, hitchhiker from the Beyond

14.content:
Long ago in the small town of woodsdale there lived five teenage friends.They always hung out togather,but wished that there was more that they could do in this town.With only around a hundred people living here,there wasn't much to do other then fish or explore the fields and trees around town,which these friends had done since they were little.Early one morning Ryan,the oldest one called all his friends and asked them to meet him in front of old Gary's supermarket,the only store in town.They all arived at 11:03a.m. to see what the fuss was about."I was busy watching a special on mineral deposits in the earths outer crust." said Robert,the brainiac of the group."This had better be worth my time."Ryan smiled."Oh, beleave me friend,it is.I don't think even one of you guys won't love this.You see I just got a call from Mike." "You mean your brother who's in collage?"Asked Samantha,the gothic member of their group."Yeah,he's on a weekend vacation for halloween,and he's staying at a motel about 20 miles up north in the next state,and he'll be visiting us tomarrow to celebrate halloween with us!" The others seemed surprised that Mike would come home for halloween when he did'nt even come home for christmas last year.This must be huge for him to want to spend his whole vacation in this tiny little place."He always did love halloween..."said Samantha."Even more then I do.What do you think he has planned for us?"
"I'm not sure,but knowing bro its gotta be good!"said Ryan with a smile."By the way,he said he'll be taking us out of town,so make sure its okay with your parents." "Sure."Everyone replied and they each walked home to ask their parents for permission.If Mike was doing something for halloween,they sure did''nt want to miss it.Tomarrow was saturday and Mike would arrive by 3:00p.m. in town for the first time in over a year.
14.title: Woodsdale

142.content: Later that night Ryan and his friends all went to bed, excited that they had all gotten permission from their parents to go on this little trip and would be spending tomorrow, the day before holloween, with Ryans cool older brother. The night however, didn't pass by peacefully, and each of the five teens dreamed strange dreams that night. They were all a little creepy, but Ryans was the scaryest by far...He dreamed of a sad little girl crying in a deep, dark woods. A strange fog hung in the air and the little girl began to sink in the mud, crying until the earth swallowed her whole. Then there came a voice, kind and loving, yet at the same time disturbed and full of evil..."Come to me little sheep, let the dark fire surrond you... come to me little sheep..." It chanted as the dream faded away to reality. Ryan sat up in his bed, covered in sweat and panting. He looked at the clock, it was 3:21 a.m. He got up, grabed a glass of water and went back to bed. At around 4:11 a.m. he drifted back to sleep...
142.title: Nightmare...

1423.content: Ryan rode his bike past the few houses that lined the small towns empty streets, it was 2:47 p.m. and Mike had said he would meet them in front of Gary's supermarket. "No way am I going to be late!" Ryan said to himself as he peddled harder, determined to get there on time. In a few more minutes he finally met up with his friends, who were all there and waiting for him. "Glad you could make it." Carlos joked as Ryan pulled up out of breath and got off his bike. "Yeah, heh heh, I slept in in..." He stuttered as he greeted each of his friends. "Bad dreams?" Samantha asked. Ryan was surprised she had guessed it. "Um, yeah, how'd you know?" Samantha grinned as she twirled a curl of her hair. "The same thing happened to all of us." They each took turns explaining the various nightmares they had experienced. "Whoa, that's freaky." Ryan said as he leaned against the side of the store. "But, then again, it is the day before Halloween..." He glanced down at his watch for a moment. "Hey, what's wrong?" Asked Tera, the shortest member of the group. "Oh, its just that its 4 minutes after 3:00. I thought my brother would be here by now..."
1423.title: Late arrival...

choices: Mike and his friend shows up
14233.content: Ryan pulled out his cell phone and dialed his home phone number. In a few seconds a sweet voice answered on the other side. "Hello, mom?" Ryan inquired as he held the phone to his ear. "Did Mike sent you any messages after I left? ... Uh-huh. Okay then, thanks mom. You too, bye." He clicked the phone off and put it back in his coat pocket. "Well?" Robert asked in an annoyed tone. "What did she say?" Ryan let out a sigh before replying. "Him and his friend Clarke got held up in traffic, they'll be here to pick us up, but not for a little while." A few members of the group let out a groan and shook their heads. "Man, I really hope what he has planned is worth it." Robert said as he began walking around to help stay warm. "Don't worry." Ryan said with a smile. "Its my brother, he's never let us down before..."
14233.title: A slight delay

15.content:
Once, about five years back, there was a group of four teenagers, not that different from you folks. They were the best of friends, I might add and they did everything together. One night, on Halloween, mind you, the loner of the group, a boy named Caleb made a suggestion.

It's important to know that Caleb wasn't exactly the happiest guy on the planet. He had quite a few 'personal issues' but I'll not get into those right now. All you need to know is that he had an unnatural obsession with Death. And that's death with a capital "D".

So anyways, on Halloween, he suggested a certain...activity. Since the age of twelve, he had been searching for spiritual meaning. I'm afraid, however, that what he found had little to do with church, with God, Buddha...hell, worshiping the Great Spaghetti Monster would have been much more desirable. Because, you see, Caleb turned to the Black Arts, with a particular fascination with Necromancy.

He had pitched the idea of a ritual to his friends, you know, as a sort of Halloween Fling. To kind of...capture the mood of the night. Brian, the unequivocal leader and self-professed 'lady's man' of the group, eagerly agreed, though he believed not one iota in an afterlife, or in magic.

Heather, a skinny, girl, who some found cute, while others saw her as a little on the homely side, also did not take much to convince her.

With three on board, they turned to the last; Lucy. She was seventeen, pretty and level-headed. It is also important to note that she WAS very spiritual, a regular ol' Bible Thumper, she was. But the ritual called for a quartet. And when Caleb asked:

"So you in, Lucy?" Everyone held their breath in anticipation...
15.title: Grave Error, A group of teens unwittingly raise...

151.content: "...Fine,I don't like it,but I'll help,just promise me you won't do anything stupid,okay?We do this ritual and forget about it,deal?"They all agreed and decided to meet that night at Caleb's house in the woods.Well,Caleb might be a little creepy,but his house was nothing short of sinister.It was in great shape,but just felt...wrong somehow.The house was big enough for 10 people to live in,yet only Caleb and his parents lived there.The house was also located deep in the woods at least 3 miles from any other house.And finally,his parents owned a small graveyard that sat on the other side of the murky creek behind the house.They had all driven in Lucy's car and arrived at Calib's house at 9:42p.m.The night was still young,chilling winds were blowing decayed leaves in a macabre dance,the tall hollow trees seemed to reach towards the moonless black sky(and towards them),and the ground was soft with mud and decayed plants.The three stepped out of Lucy's car and walked up the long gravel driveway to Calibs house,being careful not too step on anything as it was to dark to see anything vary clear.They were all glad to have remembered their coats as the cold bit and stung their already rosie cheeks."Let's hurry up and meet with Calib so we can get this over with and go home."mumbled Lucy,who had her hood up and had her hands crossed over her chest."You shiverin from this fine october air,or are you scared?"Taunted Brian."Neither.Now shut up!"replied Lucy.They all walked up the steps on Calib's front porch and Lucy rang the doorbell while Heather and Brian sat down on the porch swing by the door.They hoped he would answer the door quickly,as the porch was eeriely lit by about half a dozen jack-o-lanturns.Now these arn't your normal kid friendly carved pumpkins,they all had twisted faces,glareing eyes,and grining mouths filled with uneven pointy teeth.They didn't notice the creepy pumpkins when they got out of Lucy's car,but now that they were up close,the pumpkins looked ready to bite.Lucy pushed the doorbell button again...
151.title: House in the woods

1511.content: After about a minute Calib opened the door wearing a bath robe."Sorry,I was in the shower guys,please come in and have a seat in the living room."He said as he opened the door all the way."I'll be with you in a minute,if you're hungry you can grab something in the fridge."He walked back up the stairs and the three friends walked into the living room.They had never seen the inside of Calib's house and were quite surprised to see a living room as normal looking as this in such an expensive looking house.There was even a medium-sized t.v. sitting on a table in the corner.They all took a seat on the three person couch and unzipped/unbuttoned their coats so they would'nt get hot while they were inside.After silently sitting there for about five minutes Calib came down the stairs in his standard style of clothes:A black hoodie,black jeans,and his small silver pentagram necklace that he could'nt wear in school.He was wearing a brown backpack which was tattered and must have been at least five years old."You all ready?"he said with a smile,something he rarely did which made him seem all the more creepy. "Yeah,let's get going."said Brian as he zipped his coat back up."Good,if you'll all just follow me to the ritual site,we can get started on this little event."The four friends all headed back out the front door into the night. Heather became a little nervious at the sight of the pumpkins again."Um,did you carve those?"She asked Calib as she pointed at them."The one in front's mine,but the others are my dads,he's really good at carving up stuff."he replied as he turned to walk around the side of the house.His statment bothered Heather a little more then he did at the moment.She was feeling uneasy,but reasured herself that her friends were there, and everything was okay."Alright,the trail to the ritual site is small and hard to see, so stay close and don't lag behind."Said Calib as he walked through a few bushes and into the woods.The rest soon followed.
1511.title: Calib opens the door

15111.content: The path they walked upon was indeed small and hard to see,not to mention choked by thorns,weeds,and a few low hanging branches.If not for Calib(who they prayed knew was he was doing)and his flashlight, they would have gotten lost as soon as they entered this chilling place."So, where are your parents?"asked Brian from the back of their little hiking group."They left about half an hour ago to see a movie at the drive-in outside of town.They won't be back for at least a few hours."said Calib from the front."Wonderful..."Lucy mumbled to herself as they walked through some more weeds.After about fifteen minutes they came to a small creek that twisted through the forest like a snake.It was only about thirty feet across,but at least several miles long.The fact that it flowed about four feet under a decaying wooded bridge did'nt help them feel better about crossing it.Calib did'nt seem too scared though,as he simply kept up his walking pace as he made his way across the bridge,he did'nt even stop once until he reached the otherside."Hurry up,you slowpokes!" he called from the otherside of the creek"Don't tell me you're getting scared now,we're almost there!"Brian,who was not about to let himself be called chicken,raced across the bridge even faster the Calib had."Okay girls."they called"You're up next!"Lucy really wasn't sure if this was such a good idea anymore,but she had come this far,and she wanted to see this through to the end."Alright,here I come!" she called as she steped onto the bridge.It took her a little longer to get to the otherside,but she made it just the same.Finally there was Heather,who seemed to be really skeptical about crossing the bridge herself.The others started calling to her,telling her to hurry up and not to be scared.Nervously she put her foot on the bridge,it creaked,but held her up just fine.She slowly started to make her way across.
15111.title: The old bridge

151111.content: After about five minutes Heather was reunited with her friends on the other side of the bridge,but still could'nt shake her feelings of nervousness and paranoia.She wished she was back on the other side of the old bridge with her friends following her back to Calib's house.But that wasn't going to happen,Calib had started walking again and the others were following him.Heather walked a little faster to catch up to her friends,who seemed to become far away even though they were only a few feet in front of her.The group kept going another five minutes before their destination came into view.No more then fifty feet away was a small graveyard that could barely be seen in the darkness.It was surrounded by a black metal fence that stood only three feet high,was covered in moss,filled with weeds,and had no more then thirty tiny gravestones.The friends entered it one by one,careful not to trip over a vine or rock.Calib walked up to,and leaned agenst,the largest gravestone in the center of the cemitary,which stood almost four feet tall.The rest took their places around him next to their own graves.Calib took off his backpack and sat it down.Then he began rummaging through it,taking out small objects and sitting them on the cold ground.A chilling breeze started to pass through...
151111.title: The forgotten graveyard

None of Calib's friends wanted to smear this stuff on their face, but they had come already come this far and none of them wanted to be the one to chicken out first. When they all had their "face-paint" on they turned to Calib for the next move. Calib stood back up and...
1511111.title: Everythings ready...

15111111.content: Calib cocked his head slowly from side to side and began to say something. It sounded like he was chanting some sort of prayer. An angry demonic prayer that seemed to shake his voice as he spoke. "Mterillyh tdurikkbr osuhhqwa..." The chant soon overshadowed the sound of the wind in its intensity. Calib's friends were becoming more and more afraid by the minute. Even Brian, their unofficial leader felt a shiver crawl up his spine as their host continued his twisted chanting. Lucy was the first to notice it and called out to Brian and Heather. The three teenagers exchanged horrified looks and stood frozen in place as the voice coming from their friend grew louder and louder. This was no longer Calib, it was something else speaking through him. Finally, Heather could take no more and...

info.brief_description: Join us around the campfire as we spin five chilling tales
info.description:
This is a story that hopes to capture the feel of a campfire storytelling session. The first chapter will introduce you to your humble host and storyteller, Ben Mears. After the introductions, you will have the opportunity to choose from five potential stories.

Rules:
1. I won't delete much, but I really do not want anything explicit. This is meant to be a fun, atmospheric game to get in the spirit of Halloween.

2. Try to keep a folklore type of tone to your additions; i.e. "Once, long, long ago, there lived a widow and her two sons..."

3. Please write in the third person as the Narrator is telling the story. However, you may include first person interjections from the Narrator. For example: "Steve wasn't a bright boy, in fact, I'd say he was downright stupid. Nevertheless, he was well enough liked, though for the life of me, I can't say."

4.If you conclude a storyline, try to have a formal goodbye where the Narrator bids his guests farewell, telling them he hopes to see them next year, etc.

5.Try to be as grammatically correct as possible.

6. Happy Halloween
